ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If the student will be working with Stem Cells I would recommend the course because it gives a clear overview of the field and introduces classic as well as current research through the assigned readings.
I would recommend this to only those wishing to partake in stem cell research.

Stem cells was informative, but engaging enough, so I'm not sure that I would recommend it. It provided an overview of stem cells but there were no real assignments until the final exam which did not provide a good basis for acquiring a general knowledge.
workload is pretty minimal but might not be super engaging

It is a course on stem cell research and application which provides basic knowledge and core concepts in the current field. It is broken up into lectures focusing on each sub-fields of stem cell research including clinical applications. I would recommend it to anyone who would like to acquire more information on stem cell since the course is so comprehensive.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I have a strong interest in developmental biology so learning about stem cells in development was helpful so my potential future research.

This course provided me with sufficient knowledge about stem cell research and deepened my understanding of the entire field. It also gives me examples of how some of the concepts canbe applied to clinical use. Some of the experimental design and methods will be useful in my own research as well.
